document.masterDocTitle: The marine green and brown algae of Rodrigues (Mauritius, Indian Ocean)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The marine green and brown algae of Rodrigues (Mauritius, Indian Ocean)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntype localities.
Various in Indonesia
,
including Solor and Semau. Voucher.
HEC 14673
(zF),
19 September 2001
, Gravier (s.s. 16). Ecology. Horizontal, sand-covered rock substratum in the intertidal.
Distribution. Aldabra Islands
, Diego Garcia Atoll , India , Indonesia ( Java )
,

caption.paragraph:
Table 2.
Cladophora species
previously recorded for Mauritius and Réunion with notes on their taxonomy and distribution.

tr.td: Species recorded for Mauritius
Notes on taxonomy and distribution
Recorded for Mauritius by Dickie
Kützing
(1874: 199). Widely distributed in the
temperate zones of the northern and
southern hemispheres. The occurrence
of this species in tropical areas remains
uncertain according to van den Hoek et al .
(1990) and van den Hoek and Chihara (2000) .
Recorded for Mauritius by Børgesen
Kützing
Uncertain record: based on the description and
illustrations of Børgesen (1948: 17–18 , figure 8)
the specimens from Mauritius lack the typical
rhizoids developing from the basal poles
of the cells. According to van den Hoek
(1963) and van den Hoek and Chihara
(2000) this species only occurs in southern Europe.
Recorded for Mauritius by Børgesen

f.
inserta
f. ungulata (Brand) Setchell
Børgesen’s descriptions and illustrations the
Mauritian specimens most probably belongs

to either
C. vagabunda
or
C. dalmatica Kützing.
Recorded for Mauritius by Børgesen (1940: 36–37 ,
(Montagne) Kützing
figure 12). Based on Børgesen’s description and
illustrations the Mauritian specimens belong to

C. coelothrix
. According to van den Hoek and

Chihara (2000: 37)
C. patentiramea
possibly

represents a calm-water form of
C. coelothrix
.
Kützing
This species, described from Mauritius, is
Børgesen
characterized by acropetal terminal branch-systems
and attachment by rhizoids developing from
the basal poles of basal cells ( Børgesen, 1948: 10–13 ,
figures 3, 4; pl. I, figure 1). On the basis of
Børgesen’s description and illustrations

C. saviniana
most likely refers to
C. coelothrix
(growth forms with acropetal organization as
described by van den Hoek, 1982: 47–48 , pl. 2).
This species has been recorded from Réunion by
Kützing

Montagne and Millardet (1862: 3 ~
Cladophora ovoidea

Kützing).
C. sericea
occurs in warm to cold temperate
regions with extensions into the Arctic (van den Hoek,
1982: 96). The Mauritian record (and all other tropical
records) remain uncertain.
Species recorded for Mauritius
Notes on taxonomy and distribution

Recorded from Mauritius by Børgesen (1946: 28–29) . According to Børgesen, specimens reported from Réunion by Jadin (1935: 155) as
Cladophora repens Harvey var. colombensis Grunow
are referable to
C. socialis
and
Cladophoropsis sundanensis
.
C. patentiramea
f. longiarticulata , recorded from Mauritius by Børgesen (1940: 36–37 , figure 12), was later reduced to a synonym of
C. sociales
by Børgesen (1946: 28) .
Recorded from Mauritius by Børgesen (1940: 35–36 , figure 11).
This species was recorded from Mauritius under three
(Linnaeus) van den Hoek

different names:
Cladophora mauritiana
, described from Mauritius by Kützing (1849: 399) , was reduced to a synonym of
C. fascicularis (Mertens ex C. Agardh) Kützing
by Børgesen (1940: 35) . Both species were placed in the synonymy of
C. vagabunda
by van den Hoek (1982: 137) . Børgesen (1946: 18–21 , figures 6, 7) reported
Cladophora hauckii Børgesen
from Mauritius, a species regarded as a taxonomic synonym of
C. vagabunda
by van den Hoek (1963: 147) .
C. vagabunda
is widely distributed in all tropical and temperate seas ( van den Hoek and Chihara, 2000: 184 ).
Recorded from Mauritius by Børgesen (1940: 35–36 , figure 11).

subSubSection.paragraph: Kenya , Malaysia , Maldives , Mauritius ( Børgesen, 1940: 21 ; 1946: 15 ), Réunion
( Payri, 1985: 640 ), Rodrigues (this paper), Seychelles , Singapore , Somalia ,

paragraph.emphasis: General remarks on the distribution of

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Cladophoropsis herpestica
has not been reported from Mauritius but
C. javanica (Kützing) Silva
mentioned from that island (
Børgesen, 1946: 15
~
C. zollingeri (Kützing) Reinbold
) was not collected on Rodrigues .
